definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: Request a room away from the ice machine.
sentences.chinese: 要求一個離製冰機遠一點的房間。

sentences.english: For example, this one has an icemaker and water and ice dispensers built into the door.
sentences.chinese: 比如這臺冰箱有一個製冰機，門上還有冰水分送器。

sentences.english: The ice-maker on the starboard side, forward, was also noted to produce ice.
sentences.chinese: 且廚房後方，沙龍右前方的製冰機也能正常製冰。

sentences.english: Sorry, we forgot to open the the icing machine, so there are no ice.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天製冰機忘記開了，所以沒有冰，很對不起。

sentences.english: Water conserving ice machines are starting to pop up from several of the largest manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 最大的幾家製造商正在推出節水型製冰機。

sentences.english: You will hear a buzzing sound each time the ice maker fills with water.
sentences.chinese: 每次當製冰機充滿水時，您會聽到蜂鳴聲。

sentences.english: There's an ice dispenser near the elevator on this floor.
sentences.chinese: 這樓層的電梯旁邊有一臺製冰機。

sentences.english: See below for how to access ice and reach the power switch.
sentences.chinese: 製冰機及電源開關的使用參照以下說明。

definition: number in a sequence/ordinal number/serial number
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
